title: Amtrak service between Boston and New York suspended due to nor’easter
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Amtrak has suspended service between Boston and New York due to a nor'easter, effective until at least 4 p.m. Monday.
Wind gusts of 60-70 mph and 18-24 inches of snow are expected in New England, prompting a state of emergency.
Nearly 1,000 flights at Logan Airport were canceled Monday morning as the storm affected travel across the region.

title: ‘He said that?’: Joe Mazzulla’s reaction to Pat Riley’s Boston trash talk
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Joe Mazzulla expressed delight upon learning of Pat Riley's trash-talk against Boston before the Celtics-Lakers game.
The Celtics emerged victorious over the Lakers, winning 111-89, despite Riley's comments aimed at energizing Los Angeles.
Mazzulla emphasized focus, stating the team must maintain perspective going into their next game against the Phoenix Suns.

title: Town-by-town snow totals: Here’s what’s fallen so far in Mass.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Foxborough reported 19.3 inches of snow as of 8:44 a.m. during a heavy nor'easter affecting much of the Northeast.
Boston's Logan Airport recorded 5 inches of snowfall by 7 a.m. according to the National Weather Service.
The storm is expected to bring 18-24 inches of snow, with significant impacts in southeastern Massachusetts predicted.

title: Jim Cantore experienced thundersnow live on air in Plymouth Monday morning, and freaked out
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Jim Cantore experienced thundersnow live on air in Plymouth on Monday morning, expressing excitement at the meteorological event.
Cantore, known for his love of thundersnow, had previously encountered the phenomenon in Plymouth in the winter of 2015.
Locals were alerted to the storm's severity as Cantore was spotted in Plymouth, a sign of significant weather events.

title: Nearly 1,000 flights cancelled at Logan Airport due to nor’easter
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Logan Airport cancelled nearly 1,000 flights Monday due to a nor'easter impacting Massachusetts.
Governor Maura Healey declared a state of emergency as the storm brought severe winds and heavy snow.
JetBlue and other airlines at Logan are waiving change fees amid widespread flight cancellations.

title: Map: Hereâ€™s where power outages are being reported in Mass., R.I., N.H.
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: More than 113,000 in Massachusetts face power outages due to a strong nor'easter with high winds and heavy snow.
Approximately 14,000 Rhode Island and nearly 200 New Hampshire residents are experiencing power outages as of 8:30 a.m.
Cape and Islands areas are especially affected by power loss from snow and wind reaching over 70 mph.

title: Police investigating after piece of a pig turns up in Newton park
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A pig flank was found near Flowed Meadow, Auburndale Park, Newton, prompting a police investigation.
Newton police noted a red flag and a note left next to the pork piece in the park.
Hunting in Newton parks is banned; Newton Animal Control and Mass. Environmental Police are investigating.

title: Jaylen Brown, Payton Pritchard dominate in blowout win over Lakers: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored a game-high 32 points, despite shooting 10-for-28, in the Celtics' 111-89 victory over the Lakers.
Payton Pritchard excelled off the bench, scoring 30 points, maintaining his strong performance during the Celtics' recent winning streak.
The Celtics improved to 37-19, moving closer to a 40-win season before reaching 20 losses, despite challenges ahead.

title: These Mass. schools are closed on Monday, Feb. 23
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: A major snowstorm has led to school closures in dozens of Massachusetts school districts on Monday, Feb. 23.
Closed districts include Boston, Cambridge, Springfield, Worcester, and numerous surrounding towns like Brookline and Concord.
Residents can report additional school closures by emailing [email protected].

title: Fall River police searching for man accused of shooting, killing dog
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Fall River police are searching for Kyron Simmons, accused of shooting and killing a dog in early February.
Simmons faces charges including home invasion, animal cruelty, and carrying a loaded firearm without a license.
Police confirmed Simmons as the suspect through security footage and found firearm accessories at his residence.
